item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive." -- Sam Harris

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The philosophy of Atheism represents a concept of life without any metaphysical Beyond or Divine Regulator. It is the concept of an actual, real world with its liberating, expanding and beautifying possibilities, as against an unreal world, which, with its spirits, oracles, and mean contentment has kept humanity in helpless degradation." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length." -- Robert Frost

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Claude Levi-Strauss
item.description: "The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he's one who asks the right questions." -- Claude Levi-Strauss

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: WhollyHeretic add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "A right delayed is a right denied." -- Martin Luther King Jr.
